algorithm_technique: Level-order traversal (BFS) to find the last level and sum its nodes.
problem_summary_simple: Calculate the sum of values of all nodes at the deepest level of a binary tree.
problem_summary_technical: Perform a level-order traversal, keeping track of the nodes at the current level, and sum the last non-empty level.
key_insights: A level-order traversal (BFS) naturally processes the tree level by level.
The last level processed before the queue becomes empty contains the deepest leaves.
The space complexity is determined by the maximum width of the tree.
